title: Launching InfinitiLogicSolutions v1
summary: Announcing the initial release of InfinitiLogicSolutions, a lightweight portfolio and blog with PWA and offline support.
contentHtml:
I'm excited to share the initial release of InfinitiLogicSolutions v1 - a lightweight portfolio and blog built to be fast, simple, and dependable.

This first version focuses on the essentials:

  • Clean multi-page experience (Home, About, Projects, Blog, Post)
  • PWA install support so it can live on your home screen
  • Offline-ready reading once cached
  • A simple content pipeline that keeps updates easy

Why this matters: I wanted a space that feels professional but stays minimal - a place to ship projects, share ideas, and keep everything accessible without bloat. Hosting is handled on GitHub Pages, which keeps it free and reliable.

Next up: improving offline cache updates and adding notifications when new projects or posts go live.

If you're building something similar or want to compare notes on PWA and offline-first design, I'd love to connect.

#PWA #GitHubPages #WebDevelopment #JavaScript #OfflineFirst #Portfolio

title: Personal Portfolio Website
summary: A lightweight portfolio and blog that runs offline once cached, installs as a PWA, and stays free to host on GitHub Pages.
contentHtml:
Goal

Build a fast, lightweight portfolio plus blog that is free to host on GitHub Pages, installs as a PWA on mobile, and keeps working offline once cached.

Technologies and Tools Used

  • HTML, CSS, JavaScript
  • PWA (Service Worker + Web App Manifest)
  • Markdown to JSON content pipeline
  • Created using ChatGPT Codex

Features

  • Multi-page layout (Home, About, Projects, Blog, Post)
  • Dynamic project/blog listings powered by JSON
  • Tag filters and sorting for blog posts
  • Installable PWA (add to home screen)
  • Offline reading once cached
  • Share links and update prompts

Challenges

  • Making offline behavior reliable across pages and sessions
  • Balancing cache freshness with fast load times
  • Keeping the stack lightweight without a framework

Future Updates

  • In-app notifications when a new project or blog post is published
  • Smarter background cache updates
  • Optional analytics and performance tuning

title: Task Management App
summary: A full-featured task management application with drag-and-drop functionality, categories, and local storage persistence.
contentHtml:
A powerful yet simple task management application that helps users organize their work efficiently.

Key Features

  • Drag and drop tasks between categories
  • Local storage for data persistence
  • Priority levels and due dates
  • Search and filter functionality
  • Dark mode support

Technical Details

Built using modern JavaScript ES6+ features, with a focus on clean code architecture and user experience. The drag-and-drop interface uses the HTML5 Drag and Drop API.

All data is stored locally using the browser's localStorage API, ensuring privacy and offline functionality.

title: Weather Dashboard
summary: A beautiful weather dashboard that displays current conditions and forecasts using a third-party weather API.
contentHtml:
This weather dashboard provides users with real-time weather information in an intuitive, visually appealing interface.

Features

  • Current weather conditions
  • 5-day forecast
  • Location search
  • Temperature unit conversion (°C/°F)
  • Beautiful weather icons and gradients

API Integration

The app integrates with the OpenWeatherMap API to fetch accurate, up-to-date weather data. Error handling ensures a smooth user experience even when the API is unavailable.

Design

The UI features dynamic backgrounds that change based on weather conditions, creating an immersive experience.

title: Getting Started with Modern JavaScript
summary: A comprehensive guide to modern JavaScript features including ES6+, async/await, and modules.
contentHtml:
JavaScript has evolved significantly over the years. This guide will help you understand the most important modern features that every developer should know.

ES6+ Features

Modern JavaScript (ES6 and beyond) introduced many powerful features that make code more readable and maintainable:

  • Arrow Functions: Concise syntax for writing functions
  • Destructuring: Extract values from arrays and objects easily
  • Spread Operator: Expand arrays and objects
  • Template Literals: String interpolation and multi-line strings

Async/Await

One of the most significant improvements is the async/await syntax, which makes asynchronous code look and behave more like synchronous code:

async function fetchData() {
  try {
    const response = await fetch('api/data');
    const data = await response.json();
    return data;
  } catch (error) {
    console.error('Error:', error);
  }
}

Modules

ES6 modules allow you to organize code into reusable pieces. You can export functions, objects, or values from one file and import them in another.

Conclusion

Mastering these modern JavaScript features will make you a more effective developer. Start using them in your projects today!

title: Building Responsive Websites in 2026
summary: Best practices and techniques for creating websites that look great on all devices, from mobile phones to large desktop screens.
contentHtml:
In today's multi-device world, responsive design is no longer optional—it's essential. Here's how to build websites that work beautifully on any screen size.

Mobile-First Approach

Start designing for mobile devices first, then progressively enhance for larger screens. This ensures your site works well on the smallest devices and scales up gracefully.

CSS Grid and Flexbox

Modern CSS layout tools like Grid and Flexbox make responsive design much easier:

  • Flexbox: Perfect for one-dimensional layouts (rows or columns)
  • CSS Grid: Ideal for two-dimensional layouts

Media Queries

Use media queries to apply different styles based on screen size, orientation, or device capabilities. Common breakpoints include:

  • Mobile: 320px - 767px
  • Tablet: 768px - 1023px
  • Desktop: 1024px and up

Performance Considerations

Responsive images are crucial for performance. Use the srcset attribute to serve appropriately sized images based on the user's device.

Testing

Always test on real devices when possible. Browser dev tools are helpful, but nothing beats testing on actual phones and tablets.

title: The Power of CSS Custom Properties
summary: Learn how CSS variables (custom properties) can make your stylesheets more maintainable and enable powerful theming capabilities.
contentHtml:
CSS Custom Properties, also known as CSS variables, are a game-changer for writing maintainable stylesheets.

What Are CSS Custom Properties?

CSS Custom Properties allow you to store values that you want to reuse throughout your stylesheet. They're defined using the -- prefix and accessed using the var() function.

:root {
  --primary-color: #667eea;
  --spacing-unit: 1rem;
}

.button {
  background: var(--primary-color);
  padding: var(--spacing-unit);
}

Benefits

  • Maintainability: Change values in one place
  • Theming: Easily create light/dark themes
  • Runtime Updates: Change values with JavaScript
  • Scoping: Different values in different parts of your site

Dynamic Theming

You can change CSS Custom Properties at runtime using JavaScript, enabling dynamic themes without reloading the page:

document.documentElement.style
  .setProperty('--primary-color', '#764ba2');

Browser Support

CSS Custom Properties are supported in all modern browsers. For older browsers, you can provide fallback values.
